semantic_title: Obesity Class Coding Requirements and Documentation
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 4. Chapter 4: Endocrine, Nutritional and Metabolic Diseases > b. Obesity > 1) Obesity class

content.full_text: The obesity class codes in subcategory E66.81, Obesity class, require a fifth character to convey the severity of obesity. The obesity class should be documented in the medical record by the provider for these codes to be assigned. The obesity class codes can be reported with other obesity codes in the classification found in Chapters 4 and 15 to fully describe the condition. However, if both class 3 obesity and morbid obesity are documented, only a code for class 3 obesity should be assigned as it is more specific. (Evidence: pg no: 42, L21-L25)
content.summary: Provides specific requirements for obesity class coding including documentation needs, fifth character requirements, and specificity rules when multiple obesity types are documented (Evidence: pg no: 42, L21-L25)
key_concepts: Fifth character requirement for severity (Evidence: pg no: 42, L22)
Provider documentation requirement (Evidence: pg no: 42, L22-L23)
Combination with other obesity codes (Evidence: pg no: 42, L23-L24)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Fifth character required to convey obesity severity (Evidence: pg no: 42, L22)
detailed_rules.explanation: Subcategory E66.81 requires a fifth character to specify the exact class of obesity (Evidence: pg no: 42, L21-L22)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Provider must document obesity class in medical record (Evidence: pg no: 42, L22-L23)
detailed_rules.explanation: These codes cannot be assigned without specific provider documentation of the obesity class (Evidence: pg no: 42, L22-L23)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Can be reported with other obesity codes from Chapters 4 and 15 (Evidence: pg no: 42, L23-L24)
detailed_rules.explanation: Obesity class codes can be used in combination with other obesity codes to provide complete description (Evidence: pg no: 42, L23-L24)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Class 3 obesity takes precedence over morbid obesity when both documented (Evidence: pg no: 42, L24-L25)
detailed_rules.explanation: When both class 3 obesity and morbid obesity are documented, only assign class 3 obesity code as it is more specific (Evidence: pg no: 42, L24-L25)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Verify provider documented obesity class
Step 2: Identify specific obesity class (1, 2, or 3)
Step 3: Assign E66.81 with appropriate fifth character
Step 4: Consider additional obesity codes if applicable
Step 5: Apply specificity rules if multiple types documented

code_ranges.requirement: Requires fifth character and provider documentation

Takes precedence over morbid obesity when both documented (Evidence: pg no: 42, L24-L25)

code_patterns.description: Obesity class with fifth character for severity (Evidence: pg no: 42, L21-L22)
code_patterns.explanation: Fifth character specifies the class of obesity

coding_scenarios.scenario: Provider documents both 'Class 3 obesity' and 'morbid obesity' for the same patient
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient has Class 3 obesity, also described as morbid obesity
step_by_step: Step 1: Note both Class 3 obesity and morbid obesity are documented
Step 2: Apply specificity rule - Class 3 is more specific
Step 3: Assign only Class 3 obesity code
Step 4: Do not assign morbid obesity code

correct_coding.rationale: Class 3 obesity is more specific than morbid obesity when both are documented (Evidence: pg no: 42, L24-L25)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not code both when Class 3 is more specific
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Coding both Class 3 and morbid obesity

warnings: Cannot assign without provider documentation (Evidence: pg no: 42, L22-L23)
Class 3 obesity excludes morbid obesity coding (Evidence: pg no: 42, L24-L25)
best_practices: Verify provider documentation before assigning (Evidence: pg no: 42, L22-L23)
Use most specific code when multiple obesity types documented (Evidence: pg no: 42, L24-L25)
common_mistakes: Coding both Class 3 and morbid obesity
tips: Always check for provider documentation of obesity class
